addons.name: uBlock Origin
addons.description: Finally, an efficient wide-spectrum content blocker. Easy on CPU and memory.
addons.fullDescription:
uBlock Origin is not an "ad blocker", it's a wide-spectrum content blocker with CPU and memory efficiency as a primary feature.

***

Out of the box, these lists of filters are loaded and enforced:

- EasyList (ads)
- Peter Lowe’s Ad server list (ads and tracking)
- EasyPrivacy (tracking)
- Malware domains

More lists are available for you to select if you wish:

- Fanboy’s Enhanced Tracking List
- Dan Pollock’s hosts file
- MVPS HOSTS
- Spam404
- And many others

Additionally, you can point-and-click to block JavaScript locally or globally, create your own global or local rules to override entries from filter lists, and many more advanced features.

***

Free.
Open source with public license (GPLv3)
For users by users.

If ever you really do want to contribute something, think about the people working hard to maintain the filter lists you are using, which were made available to use by all for free.

***

    Documentation
    Release notes
    Community support @ Reddit
    Contributors @ GitHub
    Contributors @ Crowdin

screenshots.caption: The popup panel in Firefox Preview: default mode with more blocking options revealed
The unified logger tells you all that uBO is seeing and doing

addons.name: Dark Reader
addons.description: Dark mode for every website. Take care of your eyes, use dark theme for night and daily browsing.
addons.fullDescription:
This eye-care extension enables night mode creating dark themes for websites on the fly. Dark Reader inverts bright colors making them high contrast and easy to read at night.

You can adjust brightness, contrast, sepia filter, dark mode, font settings and ignore-list.

Dark Reader doesn't show ads and doesn't send user's data anywhere. It is fully open-source https://github.com/darkreader/darkreader

Before you install disable similar extensions. Enjoy watching!

addons.name: Auto Tab Discard
addons.description: Increase browser speed and reduce memory load and when you have numerous open tabs.
addons.fullDescription:
Auto Tab Discard a lightweight extension that automatically reduces the memory load of open—but inactive—tabs. This also helps portable devices to save battery.

Extension preview:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S0rHU38OnTE
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ityhxUPp3y8

Features:
1. Speeds up your browser and minimizes memory usage: Inactive, idle, or forgotten tabs can be auto-discarded after a configurable period of time, or discarded manually from the toolbar menu.
2. Designate specific tabs (websites) to be whitelisted to prevent discarding.
3. Discarded tabs can be retained after closing and re-opening your browser.
4. The tab’s favicon displays the discarded state.
5. Tabs are restored with all information intact (like scroll position or the content of text boxes).
6. When a tab is discarded, no JavaScript code or dom event is active (basically, the tab is paused).
7. Force discarding certain hostnames (e.g. you can immediately discard hostnames that use too much CPU or memory)

Options (there are a few options to customize when a tab gets discarded):
1. When a tab is pinned
2. When there is a media source playing inside a tab
3. When the computer is connected to a power source
4. When there is a form element (with changes) that has not yet been submitted.

addons.name: Qwant
addons.description: Use Qwant as the default search engine and homepage for your browser.
addons.fullDescription:
Qwant, the search engine that respects your privacy.
Designed and based in France, Qwant is the first European search engine, both efficient and ethical, that protects the freedoms of its users and ensures the preservation of the digital ecosystem. Our keywords: privacy and neutrality.

Respecting your privacy
Qwant delivers the best possible results to your searches without ever trying to find out who you are or what you do. We strongly believe that what you are looking for is your privacy. Qwant therefore does not store or use any personal data for advertising or other purposes.

You too, make your #switch2Qwant with this addon, and keep Qwant at hand, on your homepage and as your default search engine.

addons.name: React Developer Tools
addons.description: React Developer Tools is a tool that allows you to inspect a React tree, including the component hierarchy, props, state, and more. To get started, just open the Firefox devtools and switch to the "⚛️ Components" or "⚛️ Profiler" tab.
addons.fullDescription: This extension requires permissions to access the page's React tree, but it does not transmit any data remotely. It is fully open source, and you can find its source code at https://github.com/facebook/react/tree/master/packages/react-devtools-extensions.

screenshots.caption: Shows the DevTools UI with an example TODO List app.

addons.name: Clockify Time Tracker
addons.description: Track time from anywhere on the web and improve productivity.
addons.fullDescription:
Clockify is a free time tracker which you can use to manually track where you spend time.

Learn more here: http://clockify.me/firefox-time-tracking

HOW TO TRACK TIME

1. Click "+ Add to Firefox".
2. Log in to Clockify from the extension menu (or visit https://clockify.me/tracker and you'll be automatically logged in)
3. You will start noticing the "Start timer" Button in your favourite productivity tools (Trello, Jira, Asana, Gitlab, Gmail, etc.)
4. Start timer inside one of the supported web tools and the task’s name and project will be added to your time entry.

Clockify add-on also has advanced features like:

* Pomodoro timer
* Idle detection
* TIme tracking reminders

Clockify Browser Extension is open source and is welcome to all contributions: https://github.com/clockify/browser-extension

PRIVACY

The add-on doesn't collect any private information in the background (it doesn't even collect crash reports or usage analytics).

The only data the add-on collects is the one you choose to enter yourself. You can enter data manually yourself or the add-on can pick up data from other websites (such as task name in Trello) when you press "Start timer" button in them. You can see what data is picked up and it's saved once you click "Stop timer".

If you don't wish for "Start timer" to appear, you can open Settings>Integrations and revoke access to all websites and disable all integrations.

All data you enter into the add-on is covered by our Privacy Policy (in a nutshell, we don't share your data with anyone). You can find the full policy here: https://clockify.me/privacy
